title: Speak Out Against ICE with Utah Overpass Action
description: Join us at the I-215 & 13th East Overpass to oppose ICE terror in our communities. Bring your American flags and homemade signs.
raw_text:
Speak Out Against ICE with Utah Overpass Action!

I-215 & 13th East Overpass

Thursday, August 7, 8-9 am

• Meeting Spot: Parking lot at 6710 S 1300 E.
• Messages: Message text is TBD, but messages will oppose ICE terror in our communities.
• Bring your American flags! Also bring your homemade signs. (As outraged as we feel about ICE, please no violence or profanity on signs.)

Be brave with us.
• utahoverpassaction@gmail.com
• Scan the QR code for a volunteer form to get on our email list
raw_summary: The flyer promotes an event called "Speak Out Against ICE with Utah Overpass Action" planned at the I-215 & 13th East Overpass on Thursday, August 7, from 8-9 am. The meeting spot is a parking lot, and participants are encouraged to bring flags and homemade signs.

title: Smokey’s Birthday Protest
description: Join us in protesting to help save our parks on Smokey's Birthday. This event aims to rally support and awareness for environmental conservation efforts.
raw_text: IT’S SMOKEY’S BIRTHDAY! COME PROTEST! AUGUST 9 #SaveOurParks #SmokeySaysProtest 50/50 1 (logo) INDIVISIBLE (logo) (map of USA in flag colors) ALT US NATIONAL PARK SERVICE (logo) SERGEANT RHODES (logo)
raw_summary: The flyer promotes a protest event on Smokey's Birthday, encouraging actions to save parks. It features recognizable figures associated with environmental causes and uses hashtags like #SaveOurParks and #SmokeySaysProtest. The protest is scheduled for August 9.

title: Protest Against Trump's Attacks on Native Tribes
description: We invite you to a peaceful permitted protest at the sidewalk by Tivoli Fountain. Remember to bring water, sunscreen, and protest signs. Limited amenities and signs will be available.
raw_text:
PROTEST!
TRUMP’S ATTACKS ON NATIVE TRIBES
COME JOIN US FOR A PEACEFUL PERMITTED PROTEST AT THE SIDEWALK BY TIVOLI FOUNTAIN!
DON’T FORGET TO BRING WATER, SUNSCREEN AND PROTEST SIGNS!
LIMITED AMENITIES AND SIGNS WILL BE AVAILABLE AT THE TABLE.

WHEN: SATURDAY 8/9, 12-2PM
WHERE: WA STATE CAPITOL BLDG.
UN International Day of Indigenous Peoples, 8/9/2025

Oly Resistors
SPEAK UP FOR THE RIGHTS OF INDIGENOUS COMMUNITIES!
raw_summary: A protest organized against former President Trump's attacks on Native Tribes. It will be held on Saturday, August 9, 2025, from 12 PM to 2 PM at the Washington State Capitol Building. The event coincides with the UN International Day of Indigenous Peoples and includes a peaceful permitted protest with amenities provided. Organized by Oly Resistors.

title: Voter Registration at Northern Colorado Pride
description: Join us in Greeley, CO, as we celebrate Northern Colorado Pride! We will be encouraging festival-goers to register to vote, check their voter registration, receive election alerts, or get involved in their community via our Democracy Check Up page!
raw_text:
REGISTER VOTERS. PROMOTE DEMOCRACY. VOLUNTEER. HEADCOUNT.
VOTE WITH PRIDE
Time: Sunday, August 10, 10am – 5pm EDT
Location: 421 N 15th Ave, Greeley, CO 80631 Map
About this event: Join us in Greeley CO as we celebrate Northern Colorado Pride! We will be encouraging festival goers to register to vote, check their voter registration, receive election alerts or to get involved in their community via our Democracy Check Up page!
raw_summary: The image promotes a voter registration event during the Northern Colorado Pride celebration in Greeley. It is organized by HeadCount, aiming to engage people in voting activities.

title: Town Hall Announcement
description: We invite you to voice your concerns and have your questions answered regarding community and environmental issues by Commissioner Kowal and Rep. Benaroch.
raw_text:
ARE YOU CONCERNED ABOUT THE HAPPENINGS IN YOUR COMMUNITY
DO YOU HAVE ENVIRONMENTAL CONCERNS
WOULD YOU LIKE TO SEE POLICY CHANGES
VOICE YOUR CONCERNS & HAVE YOUR QUESTIONS ANSWERED.

TOWN HALL ANNOUNCEMENT:

WHO: COMMISSIONER KOWAL (R-DIST. 4) AND REP. BENARROCH (R-DIST. 81)
WHEN: WEDNESDAY AUGUST 13, 2025 5:30PM–6:30PM
WHERE: NAPLES REGIONAL LIBRARY
650 CENTRAL AVE. NAPLES, FL 34102
HOW: RSVP JAMIE.MERCHANT@FLHOUSE.GOV

BRING YOUR VOICE, BRING YOUR PROTEST SIGN, BRING NOISE MAKERS FUN OUTFITS IN CASE WE CAN'T GET IN
raw_summary: The flyer advertises a town hall meeting focused on community and environmental issues, offering attendees the chance to voice concerns and seek answers from Commissioner Kowal and Rep. Benaroch. The event is scheduled for August 13, 2025, at the Naples Regional Library in Florida.
